Class MockedModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ImageProcessor
      • MockedModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IImageProcessor

    public class MockedModel
extends ImageProcessor
    Variation of the ImageProcessor model that records a log of image editing actions taken, to be used for testing. This way, controller tests can confirm if the controller instructed the model to perform an editing operation or not. Includes a getActionLog() method to obtain a string version of the log.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MockedModel()
      Constructs a mocked ImageProcessor model with a blank action log.

      • filterImage

        public void filterImage(Filter filter,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: ImageProcessor
        Applies the specified filter (e.g. blur, greyscale, etc.) to the currently loaded image. See controller.Filter for supported filter operations and utilities.FilterUtil for implementation details.
        Specified by:
        filterImage in interface IImageProcessor
        Overrides:
        filterImage in class ImageProcessor
        Parameters:
        filter - a Filter specifying the type of filter to be applied.
        args - A list of arguments which may be referenced by the corresponding filter method next called. See utilities.FilterUtil.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no loaded image to filter.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if such an exception is thrown by a called method. See utilities.FilterUtil for how filter arguments are used.

      • generateRainbow

        public void generateRainbow(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: ImageProcessor
        Generates a rainbow image of user-specified size width, height, and orientation. Rainbow orientation can be vertical or horizontal. Height and width are specified in pixels, and must be greater than 6. The rainbow image will be stored in the model - to be edited or saved.
        Specified by:
        generateRainbow in interface IImageProcessor
        Overrides:
        generateRainbow in class ImageProcessor
        Parameters:
        args - A list of arguments needed to generate a rainbow. Must include the following, in order: the specified orientation - vertical or horizontal; the width of the rainbow in pixels; and the height of the rainbow in pixels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the required arguments are not provided or the pixel count for height or width are not greater than 6.

      • generateCheckerboard

        public void generateCheckerboard(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: ImageProcessor
        Generates an 8 x 8 black and white square checkerboard pursuant to the provided square size - the square size specifies the side length in pixels of each square in the board. The board will be stored in the model - to be edited or saved.
        Specified by:
        generateCheckerboard in interface IImageProcessor
        Overrides:
        generateCheckerboard in class ImageProcessor
        Parameters:
        args - A list of arguments for the checkerboard method. args[0] must be the side length in pixels for each of the 64 squares in the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if square size is less than 1.
